alacrity.description: Promptness in response, a cheerful readiness
alacrity.use: She accepted the invitation with alacrity

emancipating.description: To be freed from any controlling influence (such as traditional mores or beliefs)

clandestine.description: Undertaken or done so as to escape being observed or known by others

empiricism.description: A theory that all knowledge originates in experience

preponderance.description: A superiority in weight, power, importance, strength or influence
